name: Armament Support System
desc: A special modification that integrates an Alpha-class AI into the ship's fire control systems. Its primary role is to act as a backup gunnery core that drastically eases up weapon ordnance costs and raises the ship's performance above normal levels.
short: Improves autofire target lead and turret turn rate, reduces weapon OP cost.

name: Armament Support System
desc: A special modification that integrates a Beta-class AI into the ship's fire control systems. Its primary role is to act as a backup gunnery core that drastically eases up weapon ordnance costs and raises the ship's performance above normal levels.
short: Improves autofire target lead and turret turn rate, reduces weapon OP cost.

name: Armament Support System
desc: A special modification that integrates a Gamma-class AI into the ship's fire control systems. Its primary role is to act as a backup gunnery core that drastically eases up weapon ordnance costs and raises the ship's performance above normal levels.
short: Improves autofire target lead and turret turn rate, reduces weapon OP cost.

name: Missile Autoforge (C-Nanoforge)
desc: A damaged Domain-era nanoforge is installed on the ship, improving munitions capacity and allowing missile weapons to replenish themselves. The corrupted nature of the nanoforge causes some defects in the manufacturing process, limiting the throughput of the system.
short: Increases weapon ammo capacity and replenish missiles.

name: Missile Autoforge+ (P-Nanoforge)
desc: A fully intact Domain-era nanoforge is installed on the ship, improving munitions capacity and allowing missile weapons to replenish themselves. The pristine nanoforge manufactures high-quality munitions at a breakneck pace, significantly improving the autoforge's performance.
short: Increases weapon ammo capacity and replenish missiles.

name: Flux Hypershunt
desc: An operational Hypershunt Tap is installed into the ship's flux grid, significantly increasing its overall flux dissipation and vent speed. The miniature wormhole generators on the tap allow the ship to vent flux directly into hyperspace, but due to the size of the components, only capital ships can perform this modification.
short: Improves venting speed and flux dissipation. Dissipates hard flux while shields are up.

name: Maintenance Optimizer
desc: A Catalytic Core is installed into the ship's maintenance systems, vastly improving its logistical qualities. Exposed to the vacuum of space, the Catalytic Core uses osmosis physics to raise the efficiency at which the ship processes supplies. Coupled with its auxiliary power generation capabilities, this modification allows the ship to significantly lower its operating costs.
short: Reduces supply cost, CR degradation and improves CR recovery and repairs.

name: Plasma-Charged Shield Emitter
desc: A Plasma Dynamo is integrated into the ship's shield emitter. By manipulating charged particles in the solar wind, this modification stabilizes and improves the shield's flux conduits and increases the width of the shield's arc.
short: Improves shield efficiency and extends its arc.

name: Quantum Heatsink
desc: A Cryoarithmetic Engine is installed into the ship's flux conduits. Its heatsink tendrils wrap themselves around the ship's flux grid, using their anti-thermodynamic properties to lower flux buildup and improve engine resiliency.
short: Reduces weapon flux cost, increases top speed and engine health.

name: Expanded Fighter Manufactory
desc: A Combat Drone Replicator is installed into the ship's fighter manufactory. A slight change in programming allows the Replicator to improve the fighter replacement rate while slowing the speed at which fighter replacement degrades. Delta-level AI assistance allows the Replicator to support an additional fighter wing while lowering the maintenance cost of each installed production chip.
short: Reduces fighter refit time and decreases the decay rate of fighter loss in combat. Adds extra one launch bay.

name: Synchro-Fuel Loader
desc: A Synchrotron Core is installed into the ship's fuel management systems. A modification in its firmware allows the Synchrotron Core to improve the efficiency of the ship's AM fuel reaction cycle, lowering overall fuel consumption and increasing the performance of the ship's warp bubble.
short: Reduces fuel usage and planetary bombardment cost. Increases max burn level.

name: Nanite Swarm Cluster
desc: A Soil Nanite fabricator is installed into the ship's armor service bay. Modified firmware allows the nanites to dynamically reinforce the ship's armor while effecting automatic emergency hull repairs as needed.
short: Increases armor rating. Repairs hull in combat when hull integrity falls below 50%. Reduced damage taken during venting.

name: High-Throttled Weapon Torque
desc: An Autonomous Mantle Bore is installed into the ship's ballistic weaponry systems. By delicately disassembling a Mantle Bore, its many drill bits can be repurposed into auxiliary firing chambers that increase the projectile speed and maximum range of ballistic weapons while reducing their recoil.
short: Improves ballistic projectile speed and range. Reduces weapon recoil.

name: Variable Fusion Capacitors
desc: An Orbital Fusion Lamp is installed into the ship's energy weaponry. Special reflection arrays divert the Fusion Lamp's output into several auxiliary capacitors, increasing energy weapon range and damage while improving the performance of beams against shielded targets.
short: Increases beam and weapon damage and range. More damage to enemy shields.

name: HULLMOD CONFLICT!
desc: %s, the hullmod you tried to install conflicts with this hull or another previously installed hullmod.

[incomprehensible warped texts] query, query... Initiating reboot /!\
...
...
...stabilizing, system check ...1 / 2 / 3
...all green - review [protocols]
...proceeding / commencing

name: Aegis Domanorum
desc: A set of hull and system upgrades common to the unnamed "Zeroth" Battlegroup of the Domain. Pre-Collapse records indicate that the rarely-seen Zeroth Battlegroup specialized in large-scale siege warfare in operations with vital Domain assets on the line. Their efforts in the Core of the Domain won them the title of 'Aegis Domanorum', or Shield of the Domain, but their engagements were highly classified and their nature remains lost to time.

name: Refractive Lensing Array
desc: A prototype graviton lensing system developed by Fabrique Orbitale. Using a different beam refraction design from the standard High Scatter Amplifier, the Refractive Lensing Array increases beam damage and hard flux generation without any beam range loss. Fabrique Orbitale's dissolution in the aftermath of the Collapse destroyed the original plans for this hullmod spec, but an enterprising engineer may be able to replicate its effects from first principles.

name: Exotic Shield Emitters
desc: A set of experimental shield modifications developed by Altair Exotech. Designed to counteract the shield inefficiencies that plague Core Era ship designs, this suite of modifications vastly improves all aspects of a vessel's shield technology. Intended to supplement the systems of Altair Exotech's Champion, Heron, and Gryphon, the hullmod specs were lost at some point prior to the Collapse. With luck, a ship engineer may be able to replicate its effects, but such talented engineers are few and far between.

name: Heavy Ordnance Refit
desc: A series of weapon mount modifications designed by Bhilai Astra Group. Designed to support the use of ion weaponry against unshielded targets, the modifications overhaul the firing and loading systems of the ship's ballistic weapons, allowing the placement of larger weapons than would otherwise be possible while increasing weapon health and ammunition capacity. The original plans were lost after the Collapse, but selective datamining of Hegemony records may allow a sufficiently skilled hacker to piece the modspecs back together.

name: Argonaut
desc: A premium exploration suite designed by Eridani-Utopia Terraforming Company. Top-of-the-line surveying and salvaging equipment is installed on the ship alongside a special anti-reactive hull coating that protects the ship against space hazards. The plans for this hull modification were lost immediately after the Collapse, but may be rediscovered by an intrepid explorer.

name: Psyche Enhancer
desc: The ship's combat drug systems are overhauled to a prototype spec designed by Exodyne Biotech. Nootropics, experimental ESP agonists and non-addictive formulations of several party drugs replace the stimulants and anti-nausea medication common to most combat drug delivery systems, vastly increasing crewmember unity, reaction time, and their desire for a challenging fight. Repeated usage of the drug cocktail is known to cause excessive competitiveness, a compulsion to train at all hours of the day, and intense irritability when the skills of the user's crewmates are questioned. Though objectively useful, its regular usage by ship crews is considered ethically problematic by the ethics committees of most factions, with the notable exception of Tri-Tachyon (who praise the system for its 'positive team-building qualities').

name: Arsenal Tuning Refit
desc: A set of experimental firing chamber designs developed by GA-X Industries. Improved barrel rifling, energy collectors, and rail capacitors are installed in the ship's projectile weapon systems, improving projectile speed and armor penetration. In addition, loading systems are overtuned, dramatically increasing the ship's rate of fire. Miraculously, the ship's weapons do not suffer increased wear and tear as a result of these modifications, but the knowledge of how to apply the hullmod was lost during the Collapse and has not since been rediscovered.

name: Topological Logistics Overhaul
desc: A full logistics enhancement suite designed by Huan-Gogel Autofab is installed into the ship's storage and drive systems. N-brane geometry is used to modify the topology of logistics systems, increasing their storage capacity without any noticeable increase in ship volume. In addition, the ship's drive bubble is fortified with a local modification of physical constants, increasing the ship's apparent burn speed. These impressive logistical feats come at the cost of significantly increased upkeep. Many of the advanced mathematical theories required to understand and replicate these modifications were lost in the Collapse, but a gifted engineer may be able to replicate these logistical improvements from first principles.

name: Dynamic Engine Tuning
desc: A set of engine tuning specifications developed by Interstellar Dynamics. Marketed toward speed-obsessed pilots, engine safeties are either stripped down or removed entirely, significantly boosting the ship's top speed and acceleration while enabling the ship to operate at cruising speed for longer than should be possible. This comes at the cost of an extremely hot, visible engine assembly and structural weaknesses in the engine housing. As a customer service consideration, the ship's cockpit is modified with additional speed-related controls and buttons, but they do not connect to the actual drive system; rather, they control a number of force-feedback functions that emulate the feeling of controlling an overtuned petroleum-fired ground transport vehicle.

name: Hunter In The Void
desc: A series of performance and efficiency upgrades developed by Orion Shipyards that are installed in the ship's fighter nanoforges. An attempt to revitalize the waning strike craft supremacy doctrine just prior to the Collapse, this hullmod applies efficiency and quality upgrades to the ship's nanoforges that improve fighter communication systems and weapons damage while decreasing the maintenance cost of individual fighter wings. While no replacement for the superior fighter doctrines of previous eras, Hunters In The Void was a welcome addition to the fleets of many carrier groups in the late Expansion Era. With the Collapse, this design was lost, but an enterprising flight deck engineer may be able to replicate its effects from first principles.

name: Harmonized Phase Conductor
desc: A series of bleeding-edge ship modifications designed to perfect a ship's phase space drives. Developed in a now-shuttered secret facility on Culann, extant scientific papers attribute this hullmod to K. Astraia working on behalf of the Tri-Tachyon Corporation. The papers describing the hullmod's effects depict a near-complete optimization of phase space rupture technology, but lack instructions on how to perform the modifications. All references to the project disappear from Sector records after cycle 201, suggesting a sticky end for K. Astraia, a new, classified phase of the project, or - more likely - both.

name: Goedel's Incompleteness Theorem
desc:
Gödel's incompleteness theorems are two theorems of mathematical logic that are concerned with the limits of provability in formal axiomatic theories. These results, published by Kurt Gödel in 1931, are important both in mathematical logic and in the philosophy of mathematics. The theorems are widely, but not universally, interpreted as showing that Hilbert's program to find a complete and consistent set of axioms for all mathematics is impossible.

The first incompleteness theorem states that no consistent system of axioms whose theorems can be listed by an effective procedure (i.e., an algorithm) is capable of proving all truths about the arithmetic of natural numbers. For any such consistent formal system, there will always be statements about natural numbers that are true, but that are unprovable within the system. The second incompleteness theorem, an extension of the first, shows that the system cannot demonstrate its own consistency.

Employing a diagonal argument, Gödel's incompleteness theorems were the first of several closely related theorems on the limitations of formal systems. They were followed by Tarski's undefinability theorem on the formal undefinability of truth, Church's proof that Hilbert's Entscheidungsproblem is unsolvable, and Turing's theorem that there is no algorithm to solve the halting problem.

The incompleteness theorems apply to formal systems that are of sufficient complexity to express the basic arithmetic of the natural numbers and which are consistent, and effectively axiomatized, these concepts being detailed below. Particularly in the context of first-order logic, formal systems are also called formal theories. In general, a formal system is a deductive apparatus that consists of a particular set of axioms along with rules of symbolic manipulation (or rules of inference) that allow for the derivation of new theorems from the axioms. One example of such a system is first-order Peano arithmetic, a system in which all variables are intended to denote natural numbers. In other systems, such as set theory, only some sentences of the formal system express statements about the natural numbers. The incompleteness theorems are about formal provability within these systems, rather than about "provability" in an informal sense.

There are several properties that a formal system may have, including completeness, consistency, and the existence of an effective axiomatization. The incompleteness theorems show that systems which contain a sufficient amount of arithmetic cannot possess all three of these properties.

name: Langelaan Field
desc: Rend those who fail to revere you. Tear their flesh and bones asunder. Impale their lifeless husks as an example to others.

name: RedSuns Tuning
desc: A series of peculiar engine modifications designed for space 'racers'. Thrust vectoring control surfaces are removed, fuel reaction chambers are enlarged, and the engine assembly is painted red. This results in a ship much faster than would be expected given the actual modifications performed, but the extremely shoddy modification techniques make the engines unsuitable for anything other than straight-line movement.

name: Mark Of The Slayer
desc: Against all the evil that Moloch can conjure, all the wickedness that mankind can produce, we will send unto them... only you. Rip and tear, until it is done.

name: Abyss Gazer
desc: You can feel the eyes on you. Your skin crawls and your fingers shake as you ignite the ship's systems, unsure if they've finally found you, or if that feeling is just a false alarm. You can't afford to guess. Leave, now. You know they're not far behind. Don't look back. Don't betray yourself. Move forward and pretend that you can't hear them whisper in your sleep, that you can't hear their chittering wails in the gap between dreams and reality.
